practices.name: Basic Mindful Breathing
practices.description: A simple breathing exercise to help you focus and relax. Perfect for beginners.

steps.title: Get Comfortable
steps.instruction: Sit comfortably with your back straight and feet flat on the floor. Close your eyes or soften your gaze.

steps.title: Natural Breathing
steps.instruction: Simply notice your breath as it flows in and out naturally. Don't try to change it.

steps.title: Focused Breathing
steps.description: Focus on the sensation of breathing
steps.instruction: Focus on the sensation of air entering and leaving your nostrils. When your mind wanders, gently return to your breath.

steps.title: Gentle Return
steps.instruction: Take a moment to notice how you feel. Slowly open your eyes and return to your day.

instructions: Find a quiet space where you won't be disturbed
Sit comfortably with your back straight
Close your eyes or soften your gaze
tips: It's normal for your mind to wander - just gently return to your breath
Start with shorter sessions and gradually increase duration

practices.name: Progressive Body Scan
practices.description: A guided meditation that helps you relax by systematically focusing on different parts of your body.

steps.title: Preparation
steps.description: Get into a comfortable lying position
steps.instruction: Lie down comfortably on your back. Let your arms rest at your sides and close your eyes.

steps.title: Starting with Feet
steps.description: Focus on your feet and toes
steps.instruction: Bring your attention to your feet. Notice any sensations, tension, or relaxation. Breathe into this area.

steps.title: Moving Up the Legs
steps.description: Scan your legs from ankles to hips
steps.instruction: Slowly move your attention up through your ankles, calves, knees, and thighs. Notice each area without judgment.

steps.title: Torso and Arms
steps.description: Focus on your torso and arms
steps.instruction: Bring attention to your lower back, abdomen, chest, shoulders, and arms. Allow each area to relax.

steps.title: Head and Face
steps.description: Complete the scan with your head
steps.instruction: Focus on your neck, jaw, face, and the top of your head. Let go of any tension you find.

steps.title: Whole Body Awareness
steps.description: Feel your entire body as one
steps.instruction: Now feel your entire body as a whole. Notice the sense of relaxation and peace.

instructions: Lie down in a comfortable position
Don't worry if you fall asleep - that's okay
tips: Use a blanket if you get cold
It's okay if you fall asleep during the practice
Practice in a quiet, comfortable space

practices.name: Loving-Kindness Meditation
practices.description: A heart-opening practice that cultivates compassion and love for yourself and others.

steps.title: Centering
steps.instruction: Sit comfortably and take a few deep breaths. Place your hand on your heart and feel it beating.

steps.title: Self-Compassion
steps.instruction: Repeat silently: 'May I be happy. May I be healthy. May I be at peace. May I live with ease.' Feel the warmth of these wishes.

steps.title: Loved Ones
steps.instruction: Think of someone you love. Send them the same wishes: 'May you be happy. May you be healthy. May you be at peace.'

steps.title: Neutral Person
steps.instruction: Think of someone neutral - perhaps a cashier or neighbor. Send them loving wishes with the same phrases.

steps.title: Difficult Person
steps.instruction: Think of someone you have difficulty with. Try to send them the same loving wishes, even if it feels challenging.

steps.title: All Beings
steps.instruction: Expand your circle to include all beings everywhere: 'May all beings be happy, healthy, and at peace.'

instructions: Sit in a comfortable, upright position
Place your hand on your heart
Don't worry if you don't feel the emotions immediately
tips: Start with easier people and work up to difficult ones
It's okay if you don't feel loving immediately
